overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to short-term forecasting with limited data, prioritizing simplicity and robustness over complex modeling. The analyst systematically evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) but ultimately selects a simple hourly averaging technique due to data constraints, emphasizing interpretability and ease of implementation while acknowledging limitations like the inability to capture trends.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in historical data
Short data length (only 4 days of history)
key_insights: Prioritize daily seasonality over weekly patterns when data spans less than 7 days
Simple averaging per hour provides a stable baseline for very short time series
Trend adjustment is unreliable with minimal historical data (â‰¤4 days)
Reshaping data into hourly groups enables efficient pattern extraction
Seasonal naive methods become impractical when forecast horizon equals historical days
complexity_analysis: Moderate complexity: Starts with advanced model considerations but simplifies to heuristic methods after evaluating data limitations. Includes multi-step validation (data inspection, pattern analysis, method comparison) but final implementation is computationally straightforward.
